asparagus.description: Asparagus is a perennial vegetable known for its tender spears.

planting.temperature: Cool weather crop, prefers temperatures between 15°C to 25°C
planting.soil: Well-drained, sandy loam soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer before planting and again in early spring
planting.pests: Common pests include asparagus beetles and aphids
planting.harvesting: Begin harvesting spears when they are 15-20 cm tall

beetroot.description: Beetroot, or beets, are root vegetables prized for their earthy flavor and vibrant color.

planting.temperature: Cool weather crop, prefers temperatures between 10°C to 20°C
planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again 3-4 weeks later
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, leaf miners, and flea beetles
planting.harvesting: Harvest when roots reach desired size, typically 4-7 cm in diameter

broccoli.description: Broccoli is a cool-season vegetable belonging to the cabbage family.

planting.time: Late summer to early autumn for main crop; late winter to early spring for early crop
planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during dry periods
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with nitrogen-rich fertilizer at planting and again when heads start to form
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, cabbage worms, and caterpillars
planting.harvesting: Harvest when heads are tight and dark green, before flowers open

cabbage.description: Cabbage is a cool-season vegetable with tightly packed leaves.

planting.time: Late summer to early autumn for main crop; late winter to early spring for early crop
planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during dry periods
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with nitrogen-rich fertilizer at planting and again when heads start to form
planting.pests: Common pests include cabbage worms, aphids, and caterpillars
planting.harvesting: Harvest when heads are firm and solid

capsicum.description: Capsicum, or bell peppers, are sweet, crunchy vegetables commonly used in cooking.

planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when fruit begins to set
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, flea beetles, and caterpillars
planting.harvesting: Harvest when peppers reach desired size and color

carrot.description: Carrots are root vegetables known for their crunchy texture and sweet flavor.

planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil free of stones and clods
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during germination
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with low nitrogen fertilizer at planting and again when roots are halfway grown
planting.pests: Common pests include carrot rust flies, aphids, and wireworms
planting.harvesting: Harvest when roots reach desired size, typically 1-2 cm in diameter

cauliflower.description: Cauliflower is a cool-season vegetable with a compact head of undeveloped white flower buds.

planting.time: Late summer to early autumn for main crop; late winter to early spring for early crop
planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during dry periods
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with nitrogen-rich fertilizer at planting and again when heads start to form
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, cabbage worms, and caterpillars
planting.harvesting: Harvest when heads are tight and compact, before curds loosen

celery.description: Celery is a crunchy, low-calorie vegetable commonly used in salads and soups.

planting.soil: Moist, fertile soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when plants are half-grown
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, celery worms, and leaf miners
planting.harvesting: Harvest outer stalks when they reach desired size, typically 10-15 cm long

chili.description: Chili peppers are spicy fruits used to add heat to various dishes.

planting.soil: Well-drained, fertile soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when flowering begins
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, flea beetles, and caterpillars
planting.harvesting: Harvest when peppers reach desired size and color

cucumber.description: Cucumbers are refreshing, mild-flavored vegetables commonly eaten fresh or pickled.

planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during flowering and fruiting
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when vines begin to run
planting.pests: Common pests include cucumber beetles, aphids, and spider mites
planting.harvesting: Harvest when cucumbers reach desired size, typically 15-20 cm long

eggplant.description: Eggplant, or aubergine, is a versatile vegetable known for its glossy, purple skin.

planting.soil: Well-drained, fertile soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when flowering begins
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, flea beetles, and spider mites
planting.harvesting: Harvest when fruits are glossy and firm, but still immature

garlic.description: Garlic is a pungent bulb used to add flavor to a wide variety of dishes.

planting.temperature: Prefers cooler temperatures during growth, but can tolerate a wide range
planting.soil: Well-drained, fertile soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but reduce watering as bulbs mature
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again in early spring
planting.pests: Common pests include onion flies, thrips, and nematodes
planting.harvesting: Harvest when leaves begin to yellow and bulbs have formed cloves

green beans.description: Green beans, also known as string beans or snap beans, are tender, elongated pods eaten fresh or cooked.

planting.soil: Well-drained, fertile soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during flowering and pod formation
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when vines begin to run
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, bean beetles, and spider mites
planting.harvesting: Harvest when pods are firm, crisp, and about 10-15 cm long

lettuce.description: Lettuce is a leafy green vegetable commonly used in salads and sandwiches.

planting.soil: Moist, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during hot weather
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when plants are half-grown
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, slugs, and snails
planting.harvesting: Harvest outer leaves when they reach desired size, typically 10-15 cm long

mushroom.description: Mushrooms are fungi that are cultivated for their distinctive flavor and texture.

planting.depth: Depends on mushroom variety (typically 1-2 cm deep)
planting.temperature: Depends on mushroom variety (typically cool, dark environment)
planting.soil: Substrate or growing medium specific to mushroom variety
planting.watering: Keep substrate consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Depends on mushroom variety
planting.pests: Common pests include molds, bacteria, and insects (proper sanitation is key)
planting.harvesting: Harvest when mushrooms reach desired size, typically before caps fully open

potato.description: Potatoes are starchy tubers that are a staple food in many cuisines worldwide.

planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during tuber formation
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when plants begin to flower
planting.pests: Common pests include potato beetles, aphids, and potato tuber moths
planting.harvesting: Harvest when foliage begins to yellow and die back

pumpkin.description: Pumpkin is a type of winter squash known for its sweet flavor and versatility in cooking.

planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during fruit development
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when vines begin to run
planting.pests: Common pests include squash bugs, vine borers, and aphids
planting.harvesting: Harvest when fruit has reached full color and rind is hard

radish.description: Radishes are crisp, peppery root vegetables commonly used in salads and garnishes.

planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during germination
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with low nitrogen fertilizer at planting and again when roots are halfway grown
planting.pests: Common pests include flea beetles, aphids, and cabbage maggots
planting.harvesting: Harvest when roots reach desired size, typically 2-5 cm in diameter

red onion.description: Red onions are pungent bulb vegetables commonly used in cooking and salads.

planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during bulb formation
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when bulbs begin to form
planting.pests: Common pests include onion thrips, onion maggots, and nematodes
planting.harvesting: Harvest when tops begin to yellow and fall over

spinach.description: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable rich in iron and other nutrients.

planting.time: Late winter to early spring; late summer to early autumn for fall crop
planting.soil: Moist, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during hot weather
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when plants are half-grown
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, leaf miners, and slugs
planting.harvesting: Harvest outer leaves when they reach desired size, typically 5-10 cm long

spring onion.description: Spring onions, also known as scallions or green onions, are mild-flavored onions harvested in the spring or early summer.

planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during bulb formation
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when bulbs begin to form
planting.pests: Common pests include onion thrips, onion maggots, and nematodes
planting.harvesting: Harvest when tops reach desired height, typically 15-30 cm tall

tomato.description: Tomatoes are juicy, flavorful fruits commonly used in cooking and salads.

planting.soil: Well-drained, fertile soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when flowering begins
planting.pests: Common pests include aphids, whiteflies, and tomato hornworms
planting.harvesting: Harvest when fruits are firm, fully colored, and easily detach from the vine

white onion.description: White onions are mild-flavored onions commonly used in a wide variety of culinary dishes.

planting.soil: Loose, well-drained soil rich in organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during bulb formation
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when bulbs begin to form
planting.pests: Common pests include onion thrips, onion maggots, and nematodes
planting.harvesting: Harvest when tops begin to yellow and fall over

zucchini.description: Zucchini is a type of summer squash with tender, edible skin and creamy white flesh.

planting.soil: Rich, well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter
planting.watering: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during fruit development
planting.fertilizing: Fertilize with balanced fertilizer at planting and again when vines begin to run
planting.pests: Common pests include squash bugs, vine borers, and aphids
planting.harvesting: Harvest when fruits are small to medium-sized and tender
